creator: coad@measurement-factory.com
text:
Looks like a possible RFC 2616 MUST violation. 
Apache caches response to a request with no-store
cache-control directive. The bug is submitted 
with elevated severity level because the violation
might affect end-user privacy.

See attached trace for details and ways to reproduce
the violation.

Test case IDs in the trace link to human-oriented test case
description and RFC quotes, if available.

This is a mod_disk_cache only defect. mod_cache and mod_mem_cache are handling 
no-store as it is suppose to be.
creator: jjclar@novell.com

text:
I jave not verified your report with tests, but 
I have changed the Component field of this bug report to mod_proxy.

I do not see a mod_disc_cache component in Bugzilla.
creator: coad@measurement-factory.com

text:
This is resolved in the latest release of httpd.

Thanks!
creator: jerenkrantz@apache.org

text:
Created attachment 15317
trace with httpd-2.0.54

The violation seems to be present in httpd-2.0.54
creator: coad@measurement-factory.com
coad@measurement-factory.com
text:
Reopening the bug since the violation seems
to be present in httpd-2.0.54. 

The attached trace has been generated with
mod_disk_cache. (We cannot build mod_mem_cache
on FreeBSD using the default build process).
It seems as of 2.0.60 the issue is fixed.
creator: davi@apache.org
